actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston under the authority of the order of Aug 2, 89 with an amendment in the nature of a substitute and an amendment to the title. With written report No. 101-110.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 210.
Passed Senate with an amendment and an amendment to the Title by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

official_title: An Act to direct the Secretary of the Interior to establish a Cave Research Institute.

summary.text: Cave Research Institute Act of 1989 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior, acting through the National Park Service, to establish the Cave Research Institute as a center for the collection, analysis, and dissemination of research material related to caves in Carlsbad Caverns National Park, New Mexico, the Capitan Reef area, and other lands managed by the Service. Requires the Secretary to transmit to the Congress an operational plan for the institute. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: A bill to direct the Secretary of the Interior to establish a cave research institute at Carlsbad Caverns National Park.
An Act to direct the Secretary of the Interior to establish a Cave Research Institute.
